Description: Ostracon, fragment of the body of a light-brown pottery vessel, interior slightly grooved, exterior covered with a burnished cream-coloured slip and remains of one line of black-painted hieratic text, identifying contents as [meat] for birth of Aten (New Year's Day) and with slight traces of red (blood).
Curator's comments: Peet & Woolley, City of Akhenaten I. Pl. LXIV fig. 78
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (393193) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/393193)
Associated events: Named in Inscription: Birth of Aten
